articles.title: Ex-Intel engineer: Apple turned away from Intel over Skylake CPU bugs - ZDNet
articles.description: "The quality assurance in SkyLake was abnormally bad," says former Intel engineer François Piednoël.
articles.content:
A former Intel engineer reckons Apple decided to switch from Intel due to the unusually high number of bugs in the chip maker's Skylake CPUs that powered Macs released between 2015 and 2017.
